title: Hi, I'm Loathey, Esports Coordinator at Riot Oceania. Ask me anything!

embed.description: The latest Tweets from Laura (@loatheypp). Aussie. Esports Coordinator at Riot Games Oceania. Herding cats (OPL players). Sydney, New South Wales

body:
Hey Summoners,

I'm Laura (Loathey), and I'm Oceania's Esports Coordinator. I'll be around for the next few hours answering any questions you have!

I started at Riot just over 6 months ago after being a tax accountant and managing a Twitch League of Legends streamer. A lot of my role involves interacting with our OPL players - I spent 5 days with all the League of Legends: League of Origin players last week while they prepared for the event (side note: our pro players are awesome). I was also lucky enough to travel to Brazil with the Dire Wolves for MSI, and will be attending Rift Rivals in Vietnam with the teams!

I'm currently a support player who dabbles in ADC - I don't get to play as often as I'd like, so I feel support is easier to slot back into the game! My favourite champions currently are Nami, Zyra and Caitlyn.

Outside of my life of computers I've been into netball since a super young age, but unfortunately I haven't been able to play any this year so far. If anyone in Sydney plays somewhere reasonably close to Pyrmont and needs a fill in on a weeknight, I'm in! I also love spending time with my family - they're mostly in Victoria so I don't get to see them as much as I would like... but there's always Skype.

Go ahead and ask me anything :)

replies.body: If someone wanted to do what you do, what would you recommend they do to prepare?

A lot of what I do is about attention to detail and organisation. I think a great path to something like I do would be team management - regardless of whether it's esports or traditional sports, I think there's a lot of crossover between the roles. If you can get involved as a team manager of an esports team and do a kickass job, all the better! 
I think one thing that really helped me with being employed by Riot was the time I spent as secretary at my local football/netball club. Along with taking all the notes for our meetings I was also on our social committee, where there was a lot of planning and details involved. When I was applying for the position at Riot I had to do a practical task, and a lot of the things I took away from my time as secretary were applied to the task.
Who is your favourite OCE Rioter and why do they sit opposite you in the office? <3
Obviously you. You sit opposite me because you did the seating plan! <3
naiiiiiled ittttt

eSports in OCE seems to be gaining momentum. IEM Sydney, new investors in league teams. 

As someone who has frequent contact with players and casters and other important people called Benji, can you tell me how it's being received? And what do you think is the next big step for OCE eSports?

"other important people called Benji" :D

I think everyone is really excited about the steps that have been taken recently. IEM Sydney was great to go to as a spectator, and I would love to see more big events in Oceania. 
Having Adelaide Crows invest in Legacy is fantastic for esports. Personally, I would love to see more traditional sports teams investing (Richmond pls come love us) - if we can get the teams having really solid infrastructures I think that's a great step to OCE performing well internationally.

How do you feel about it all?

Personally and this is just my option. OCE will never be a competitive sever. For the simple fact we lack the ability to scrim with better teams. To put this simply oce will never do well internationally, we lack the money that all the top severs do and we lack the raw talent that they have. oce will stay near the bottom and we are never leaving there.

If you think the only things stopping us from being competitive are that we don't scrim with better teams and we don't have the infrastructure in place, those both seem like things that have fairly straightforward solutions.

I think over the course of the next 12-18 months, eSports is going to explode in Australia. Already there's a lot of discussion around what the next big investment for the Australian economy will be - mining is on its last legs and tourism is something that doesn't pay off immediately, so an industry like eSports is in a prime position to benefit from that hole.

So first of I would like to hear your straight forward solution to not being able to scrim better teams and not have the infrastructure. 

As for e sports exploding in the next 12 to 18 months. I honestly find that very unlikely as 1 we honestly don't have the population to support it.  2 watching the OPL is not that great in all honesty. If of you watch an OPL game then say NA or the LCK the quality of game play  between isn't even comparable. It would be like watching a silver elo game and than a challenge elo game and saying the silvers are just as clean in how they play as the challangers are.

What if anything is being done about the intent feeding and griefing that's rife in League of Legends?

It seems the only focus is on those who show toxicity instead of coming down hard on the actual players who ruin the game.

A toxic person can be dealt with swiftly via the mute button yet we are powerless against an intent feeder/griefer.

A 0 tolerance in ranked games should be adopted and bans dealt with swiftly and harshly.

I have 0 faith in the reporting system and it's ability to punish those ruining the game on a constant basis and I'm sure a lot of others share the same disappointment.

Greetings Laura, sorry if I'm late for questions!

As per my AMA tradition I have two serious questions for you, and two fun questions for you. (Trying to think of ones I didn't already ask you at League of Origin xD )
---
* If I may ask what core skills transferred over from managing a twitch streamer to being a eSports coordinator?


* What are the key things that you enjoy about eSports and your job?


* What was the first video game that you played?


* If you had to pick someone from the OCE office to 'backseat-shoutcast' (sit behind you and shoutcast what you are doing) your games who would it be and why?


* (Bonus round!) How much is your control+4 keys worn out since you play so much Nami? :P
---
Thank you and was nice meeting you on the weekend!

~Elam

Hello Lisa,

Long time reader, first time poster (in this discussion). Please can you tell us
a) Your favourite type of bean and or legume
and
b) Why you like to sneak up on people

Thank you for your time, Linda

Hey Mark (this is our OPL producer, Boagie),

a) Mr Bean

b) You're just easily scared

See you tomorrow!

Obligatory who's your favourite referee and why is it me? :P

Though on an actual note where would you wanna be in a few years time? Is it an eSports team manager or perhaps mastering your craft in player co ordinating more?

Hi Toasties, you are my favourite ref because you have commented on my ama <3

I'm actually not sure what I want to be doing in a few years. I think I would really like to work event coordination for something like MSI (plenty of organising venues etc), but ultimately I love what I'm doing at the moment and would not complain if I was still doing this kind of role in the future.

how come you never visit kobe anymore??

is he a bad boy?? {{champion:32}}
Last I heard you weren't in the state of New South Wales! I miss you Kobe :(

You're in a position where you have to satisfy the Company you work for, the Teams / players whom depend on you, and the players / viewers who benefit from a job well done.

Is one of these more important than the others in terms of how you prioritise your day to day tasks? or is this all just a balancing act that requires a lot of sacrifice and discipline?

Hey Jason!

It depends on the situation as to what gets prioritised, but generally we're all about the player experience. The things I'm involved in that affect broadcast (and therefore viewers) are mostly around the pro players being ready for stage, and the guys are all great about this. On the OPL weekends I try to do a bit of other work, but it's more important that our show runs smoothly and the players in the building are happy! Sometimes it's pretty tough to balance everything, and some days can be fairly long... but I love what I get to do!
When will Tyler1 be freed

Hi Laura,

Three questions:
1. Are there any female  professional LOL players in other regions?
2. Are we getting the OPL show back this split? (Follow-up, is so, when?)
3. Have the LOL Origin interview RP bonuses been processed? I'm worried my attritocuous handwriting may have let me down.

Hey Lloydhavemercy!

1. I haven't come across any females who are playing professionally, but there are a lot of regions that I don't watch. I believe Remilia is a sub for FlyQuest, and Proxyfox a sub for H2K, but I can't think of anyone who is a starter. Would definitely love to see some kickass girls come through though.
2. I unfortunately don't have an answer to this one for you. [Benji](https://twitter.com/RiotBenji) would be the one to ask about that!
3. I just spoke to Dom and the RP should be through!
Who are the most and least annoying people you deal with?

Most annoying people are those who don't check their emails. A lot of my correspondence is through that medium, so to not hear responses for days can be quite frustrating!
Least annoying would be Kitty, our floor manager for OPL. She is absolutely wonderful and so easy to deal with, and she takes care of our casters and analyst desk so well.

Who is your favourite cat to herd? 
Do you like coffee?
Which champion would you delete from the game?
If you weren't working for Riot, which team would you support this split?

Geez, 2 questions where you're asking me to pick favourites! 

1. The players are all really great - they all tend to listen when I talk at them... not sure if that's because they're scared of me, but I'll take it.
2. I don't really drink coffee, I tend to stick to water most of the time. It's not that I don't like the taste of it, it's more that I don't really think I need it.
3. Initial reaction is to say Yasuo, but having a think about it, it'd be Udyr. The only time I've seen it played this season is when Spawn played it top yesterday, so I think he either needs a rework or to go bye bye.
4. I actually came into the Oceania office without having a favourite team, so I'm not sure! I've cheered on the Chiefs when they've gone international in the past, but I don't think that necessarily means I'd be supporting them - there's a lot of great personalities that we get to see now that the teams are accessible for content in Sydney.
What time is dinner, Mum?

Story time. League of Origin was a fantastic event. Many of the players took to calling me mum throughout the week and I'm not sure how I feel about it. 
Now they all owe me birthday presents.
Who is your favourite duo queue partner
Looking for new duo queue partner - any takers?
Yeah same for me actually, looking for someone who can play melee supports {{summoner:14}}
Do you poop {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
